Description: Body sherd of Laconian black-figured pottery kylix; dull cream slip; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of an unidentified image, part of which is in added red; in bottom left corner, a pomegranate; exterior: friezes of short rising rays and short tongues (some of which have a red dot at their centre) separated by wide red band between pairs of narrow black bands.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B7.4.7)
Stibbe 1972 / Lakonische Vasenmaler des sechsten Jahrhunderts v. Chr. (p. 240-1, no. 181, pl. 56.9-10)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 555, no. E24)
Venit 1985 / Laconian Black Figure Pottery in Egypt (p. 396, no. 24)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 240, no. 24)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GC.12) (Phase 1)
